sections.1_story_intuition: Economy is the study of how resources are produced, distributed, and consumed. Understanding basic economic concepts is crucial for competitive exams, as questions often test knowledge of terms, principles, and the structure of the Indian and world economy.
2_key_definitions: Economy: System of production, distribution, and consumption of goods and services.
GDP (Gross Domestic Product): Total value of goods and services produced within a country.
GNP (Gross National Product): GDP plus income from abroad.
Inflation: General rise in prices over time.
Fiscal Policy: Government policy on taxation and spending.
Monetary Policy: Central bank policy on money supply and interest rates.
Budget: Annual financial statement of income and expenditure.
Subsidy: Financial aid by government to reduce prices.
Balance of Payments: Record of all economic transactions with other countries.
3_key_facts_data_points: India is the 5th largest economy by nominal GDP (2025).
RBI (Reserve Bank of India) is the central bank.
GDP is measured at market prices.
Inflation in India is measured by CPI and WPI.
Fiscal year in India: 1st April to 31st March.
Union Budget is presented by the Finance Minister.
NITI Aayog replaced Planning Commission in 2015.
India's main sectors: Agriculture, Industry, Services.
Primary sector: Agriculture, mining.
Secondary sector: Manufacturing, construction.
Tertiary sector: Services, IT, banking.
FDI: Foreign Direct Investment.
PPP: Public-Private Partnership.
Disinvestment: Sale of government stake in PSUs.
Subsidies are given on food, fertilizer, fuel.
GST (Goods and Services Tax) introduced in 2017.
India's largest trading partner: USA.
Unemployment rate is a key economic indicator.
Repo rate: Rate at which RBI lends to banks.
India is a member of WTO, IMF, World Bank.
4_micro_notes: Fiscal deficit: Excess of expenditure over income.
GST is a unified indirect tax.
NITI Aayog is a policy think tank.
5_exam_capsules: What is the full form of GDP? Gross Domestic Product.
What is inflation? General rise in prices.
When is the Union Budget presented? February.
What is GST? Goods and Services Tax.
What is the fiscal year in India? 1st April to 31st March.
What is FDI? Foreign Direct Investment.
What is the repo rate? RBI lending rate to banks.
Which sector is largest in India? Services.
Who replaced Planning Commission? NITI Aayog.
What is disinvestment? Sale of government stake in PSUs.
Who presents the Budget? Finance Minister.
What is the main function of WTO? Promote global trade.
What is CPI? Consumer Price Index.
7_traps_confusing_points: Mixing up fiscal and monetary policy.
Assuming inflation is always bad (moderate inflation is normal).
Mixing up FDI and FII (Foreign Institutional Investment).
Confusing repo rate with reverse repo rate.
Assuming NITI Aayog is a ministry.
Mixing up budget deficit and fiscal deficit.

8_case_study_context.title: GST Implementation in India
8_case_study_context.explanation: GST, introduced in 2017, unified multiple indirect taxes into a single tax, simplifying the tax structure and improving compliance. It is considered a major economic reform in India, impacting businesses and consumers alike.
